text: Joseph Aloysius O'Hare (February 12, 1931 â€“ March 29, 2020) was a Jesuit priest, civic leader, educator and editor. He was president of Fordham University from 1984 to 2003. He was born in The Bronx, New York. O'Hare was associate editor of the Catholic weekly America from 1972 to 1975 and was editor in chief from 1975 to 1984. O'Hare died on March 29, 2020 at a retirement home in The Bronx of liver cancer-related problems, aged 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American editors Category:Educators from New York City Category:American Jesuits Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:Writers from New York City
title: Joseph A. O'Hare
